      • sendGwei

        public java.lang.String sendGwei(java.lang.String privKeyHex,
                                 java.lang.String dest,
                                 java.lang.String howMuchGwei,
                                 java.lang.String data)
        Send Gwei = 10-9 ether.
        Parameters:
        String - privKeyHex, the private key of the sending account in hexadecimal
        String - dest, the address of the receiver in hexadecimal
        String - howMuchGwei, number of Gwei to send
        String - data, the data to encript in the transaction, usually the identity hash here
        Returns:
        the transaction hash if successful, if not a String Error : with an explaination of why it failed.

      • initializeWeb3

        public void initializeWeb3()
        Build a Web3j object to access to the blockchain, if one wasn't created before. This function isn't visible from AppInventor.

      • getTransactionStatus

        public java.lang.String getTransactionStatus(java.lang.String transactionId)
        Get the status of a transaction
        Parameters:
        String - transactionId, the hexadecimal id of the transaction to scan
        Returns:
        a String, describing the status if successful, with a Error : + explanation if not.

      • getTransactionDetails

        public java.lang.String getTransactionDetails(java.lang.String transaction_0x)
        Retrieves all the details in a transaction
        Parameters:
        String - transaction_0x, the hexadecimal id of a transaction
        Returns:
        if the network is reachable : a String with the block, sender, receiver, amount and date; if not, a String Error.

      • isValidAccountUserHash

        public java.lang.String isValidAccountUserHash(java.lang.String transaction_0x,
                                               java.lang.String address,
                                               java.lang.String hash)
        Checks if the account hash has been registered in a transaction. To be correst, the transaction must have been send by the user which adress is specified, and with a data which is the same as the specified hash (identy check).
        Parameters:
        String - transaction_0x, the hexadecimal id of a transaction
        String - address, an hexadecimal address
        String - hash, an identity hash (typically corresponding to the address before)
        Returns:
        OKHASH or Wrong hash. Error if the network isn't reacheable.

      • isValidAccountQaxhHash

        public java.lang.String isValidAccountQaxhHash(java.lang.String txId1,
                                               java.lang.String hash2)
        Checks if the A2 transaction (certification of identity by the plateform) exists and has the expected hash.
        Parameters:
        String - txId1, the hexadecimal id of the 1 transaction for this user
        String - hash, the hash that must be found for the 2 transaction
        Returns:
        OKHASH/A2TxId/address or an "Error : *" message where A2TxId is the id of the A2 transaction if found, address the sender of the A2 tx (to be compared later with the known qaxh plateform addresses.

      • readReceivedUntilNow

        public java.lang.String readReceivedUntilNow(java.lang.String address,
                                             java.lang.String creationBlockNumber)
        Retrieves all the transactions received by this address, from the creation (indicated by the creationBlockNumber parameter) to now.
        Parameters:
        String - address, the address of the user to search received tx for.
        String - creationBlockNumber, the blockNumber where the address was "created"
        Returns:
        a list of tx id, encoded in a String : 0x... / 0x... / Ox... .

      • readReceivedOneBlock

        public java.lang.String readReceivedOneBlock(java.lang.String address)
        Retreive all the transactions received by this user, since the last call to this function or readReceivedUntilNow() to now. The readReceivedUntilNow() function must have been called at least once before. Note that this function CAN in fact pull more than one block, but this name was chosen to illustrate the expected use of the function : it is designed to be called every 15 sec. on the rinkeby testnet. So it should TYPICALLY only pull one block. NB (development) : is also used in readReceivedUntilNow() funtion, to pull much more than one block.
        Parameters:
        address, - the address of the user to retreive received transactions for.
        Returns:
        a list of received transaction, encoded in a String like so : 0x... / 0x... / 0x...

      • toChecksumAddress

        public java.lang.String toChecksumAddress(java.lang.String address)
        Return the address, but "checksummed"
        Parameters:
        String - address, the address to transform
        Returns:
        String checksum

      • set

        public java.lang.String set(java.lang.String value,
                            java.lang.String address,
                            java.lang.String privateKey)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Call the set function of the greeter contract
        Parameters:
        value - : the value to be set in the greeter contract
        address - : the address of the user (String, format hex)
        privateKey - : the private key of the user (String, format hex, without 0x at the beginning)
        Returns:
        the transaction hash of the transaction used to access the smart contract
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - : for various reasons
